Fifa have unveiled the trophy they will be giving to the world's best player on Monday night. 
It will be a new award which is part of the inaugural Best Fifa Football Awards. 
Fifa no longer represent the Ballon d'Or after ending its six-year collaboration with magazine France Football. 
The winner of the Puskas Award will be announced on the same night. 
Made out of aluminium, brass and carbon - the trophy consists of many parts: the bottom, a carbon base, the body and a ball on top. The Anatomy of a Trophy (Photo: YouTube/FIFATV) 
The ball on top represents the football used in the first ever World Cup played in Uruguay in 1930.
